page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area is situated in the east coast of Scotland.The land is mainly used for farming and there are many small farms dotted around.There is a picnic area in Killrenny common.In Kilrenny there is an old church which dates back to 1634.This was built by St.Adrian. There are no shops.In 1926 two bronze age cists were found near Caiple.There is a small area of sea.This is the Firth of Forth.there are not many inhabitants.The only industry is farming although there used to be a quarry but it has been closed down.Alsothere used to be a railway line open which took people to Waid Academy (nearby school).It was closed down when the car became popular.This area is not very exciting.But there are some historical places to visit.
